snippet: An analysis of 43 popular wellness apps by the nonprofit Privacy Rights Clearinghouse found that many apps connect to advertising and data-analysis sites without the user’s knowledge.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column; notes analysis of 43 popular wellness apps by nonprofit Privacy Rights Clearinghouse finds that many apps connect to advertising and data-analysis sites without user’s knowledge; says apps can be useful in providing information and motivation, but warns privacy is not priority.
lead_paragraph: An analysis of 43 popular wellness apps by the nonprofit Privacy Rights Clearinghouse found that many apps connect to advertising and data-analysis sites without the user’s knowledge.

headline.main: Free Apps for Nearly Every Health Problem, but What About Privacy?
headline.print_headline:
In Health Apps,
Lots of Information,
But Not Much Privacy
